heroIntro:
Imagine waking up to Mediterranean sunshine, stepping onto your own Spanish terrace, and knowing you've secured one of the best-value properties on the Costa Blanca. This exceptional 3-bedroom town house in Rojales offers the perfect Mediterranean escape at just €367,900—a premium-specification property that costs 40% less than comparable homes in Spanish island markets.

Rojales sits at the heart of Costa Blanca's most vibrant region, where golden beaches meet authentic Spanish pueblo charm. Whether you're seeking a holiday retreat where friends and family gather year-round, a second home that generates rental income, or a genuine investment in European sunshine, this property delivers on every front. With 113m² of thoughtfully designed living space set on a 124m² plot, you get the intimacy of a townhouse with the flexibility of outdoor space—perfect for those long Spanish afternoons.

This isn't just about location; it's about lifestyle. Rojales offers that rare combination: close enough to modern amenities and international beaches to feel connected, yet rooted in authentic Spanish culture. At €3,256/m², you're buying into an area appreciating at 8% year-on-year, where similar properties rent for €800+ per week during peak season. This is Costa Blanca done right.
areaSection: Rojales is a 20,000-soul pueblo tucked between Alicante's two greatest assets: the white-sand beaches of the Mediterranean and the Vega Baja agricultural region. Just 45 minutes from Alicante Airport and 20 minutes from Blue Flag beaches, Rojales has quietly become the thinking buyer's choice on Costa Blanca. The town sits on the Segura River, creating a distinctive microclimate—summers are hot but tempered by sea breezes, winters are mild and sunny (over 320 days of sunshine annually). Unlike the over-developed coastal strips, Rojales maintains authentic Spanish character: weekly markets burst with local produce, traditional tapas bars line cobbled streets, and genuine hospitality hasn't been commercialized. The surrounding region offers championship golf courses, water sports facilities, and a thriving international community where English is widely spoken—proving you can have Spanish authenticity without cultural isolation.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Rojales strikes an enviable balance. Your mornings might start at a local café with strong café con leche and churros, watching Spanish life unfold in the plaza. Mid-morning, you're 20 minutes from multiple Blue Flag beaches for swimming or a beach restaurant lunch. The international community is established and welcoming—many long-term expats have built genuine social networks here. Shopping is convenient: Mercadona and Lidl for everyday groceries, traditional markets for fresh local produce, and larger shopping centers 15 minutes away for anything specialized. Healthcare is excellent; English-speaking doctors are available through private clinics and the regional hospital is 30 minutes away. Evenings? Choose between tapas in town, beachside restaurants, or golf course dining at one of several championship courses nearby. The cost of living is genuinely affordable—your holidays here will stretch further than anywhere else in Western Europe. This is Mediterranean living without the pretension or premium pricing.
investmentSection: Rojales represents one of Costa Blanca's most intelligent property investments. The market trend shows consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation—significantly outpacing inflation and typical European real estate. At €367,900, you're buying at €3,256/m², well above the area average of €2,200/m², but this premium specification pricing reflects genuine value. Rental potential? Typical 7-night holiday lets achieve €800+, meaning annual gross rental income could exceed €18,000 from just 9 weeks of bookings. Many owners operate part-year holiday rentals (June-September peak season), then enjoy the property personally in quieter months. The established expat community and improving infrastructure (new restaurants, golf facilities, wellness centers) continue driving demand. Unlike speculative coastal properties, Rojales offers both personal enjoyment and genuine financial sense.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom town house represents everything smart holiday home buyers seek: authentic location, reliable investment fundamentals, exceptional value, and genuine livability. At €367,900 in an area appreciating 8% annually, with €800+ weekly rental potential, you're purchasing both a personal Mediterranean escape and a sensible financial asset. Whether you envision family gatherings on the terrace, quiet winters watching sunsets, or summer weeks hosting friends, this property delivers. Rojales has quietly become Costa Blanca's best-kept secret—authentic Spain combined with international convenience, without island pricing or tourist-zone complications. Schedule your video tour or arrange a viewing via WhatsApp: we can connect you directly with property specialists who speak your language and understand international buyers' needs. Your Mediterranean life starts here.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Rojales provides the everyday conveniences modern residents expect, without the impersonal feel of larger developments. The pueblo maintains authentic Spanish character while offering reliable access to healthcare, education, shopping, and transport.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in the Rojales region is comprehensive and reassuringly accessible. The regional Hospital General (30 minutes away) provides full emergency and specialist services. Multiple private clinics operate in Rojales and nearby Torrevieja, with many doctors fluent in English—crucial for non-Spanish speakers managing medical situations. Pharmacies are abundant and English-speaking staff is standard. Dental clinics offer competitive pricing compared to UK private dental care. The healthcare system is EU-standard, and many expats choose private insurance (available from €50-100/month) for faster appointments and consistent English-speaking care. Medical tourism to Spanish private clinics is common among UK property owners, as costs remain significantly lower than private UK healthcare.
keyPoints: Private clinics in Rojales - English-speaking doctors available
Pharmacies on every corner - English-speaking staff

education.text: While Rojales itself is primarily a retirement and second-home destination, excellent international schools operate within 10-20 minutes by car. British curriculum schools cater to expat families throughout the region. Several international education options provide continuity for families moving between countries. Many properties in Rojales are owned by families who use them seasonally, with children continuing education in their home countries. Nearby Torrevieja and Alicante have established international school communities with strong reputations.
keyPoints: Online international schooling popular among digital families

shopping.text: Shopping in Rojales efficiently combines modern supermarkets with authentic Spanish markets. Mercadona and Lidl operate within walking distance, offering competitive pricing and reliable stock. The weekly market (held in the town center) is legendary among expats for fresh produce at bargain prices—Tuesday mornings attract buyers from across the region. Larger shopping centers like La Zenia Boulevard (20 minutes away) provide everything from fashion to electronics. English-language bookshops, international food suppliers, and specialized shops serve the expat community. Online shopping (Amazon, Spanish retailers) is reliable, with most deliveries arriving within 48 hours.

La Zenia Boulevard shopping center - 20 minutes for major brands

transport.text: Alicante Airport—the gateway to Costa Blanca—sits just 42 minutes away, making UK airport runs or international travel straightforward. Local bus connections link Rojales to beaches, nearby towns, and shopping centers, though a car provides genuine flexibility for exploring the region. Parking throughout Rojales is free and abundant. Many residents drive a second car in Spain (purchase prices are competitive) or rely on rental firms offering short-term European lease agreements. Highways are modern and well-maintained. For those without driving experience in Spain, taxis and ride-sharing services operate efficiently, and many expat networks organize shared transport.

Local buses to beaches & towns - €1-2 per journey

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca has experienced consistent property appreciation (8% annually in Rojales), established infrastructure, and one of Europe's largest English-speaking expat communities. Unlike speculative coastal markets, Rojales combines genuine livability with investment potential. The region benefits from tourism demand, excellent climate, and strong rental market fundamentals. Property ownership here serves both lifestyle and financial objectives simultaneously.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, without restriction. UK citizens, Americans, Australians, and buyers from virtually any country can purchase property in Spain freely. No special visa or residency status is required—you simply need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), easily obtained during the purchase process. Spanish solicitors and property advisors regularly handle international purchases. The process is straightforward and transparent.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-12% of the property price, including: transfer tax (6-8%), legal fees (€500-1,500), surveyor fees (€300-600), notary fees (€400-800), and property registration (€100-300). Ongoing costs are minimal: annual property tax (IBI) averages €200-400/year in Rojales, plus minimal community fees (often €30-50/month). These are genuinely low compared to UK property ownership.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI - Impuesto sobre Bienes Inmuebles) in Rojales averages €250-400/year depending on official property valuation. Community fees in gated developments typically run €30-60/month (€360-720/year). Once purchased, these are your only regular property-related taxes. There's no annual wealth tax on property ownership, unlike some European countries. Capital gains tax applies only when you sell at a profit.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to international buyers (typically up to 80% of property value). Interest rates are competitive—currently around 3.5-4.5% for fixed-rate mortgages. You'll need: proof of income, credit history, and usually a Spanish NIE number. Many UK expats use a mix of Spanish mortgages and UK offshore mortgages, depending on tax efficiency. Consulting a Spanish financial advisor ensures you structure financing optimally.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Living costs in Rojales are significantly lower than UK equivalents—roughly 30-40% cheaper overall. Groceries cost 20% less; restaurant meals average €12-18 for lunch menus; utilities run €60-100/month; wine and olive oil are a fraction of UK prices. Many retirees report living comfortably on €1,200-1,500/month for all expenses. For holiday home owners, costs are minimal—property sits empty, you pay only taxes and maintenance.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca gut für Rentner?
faqs.answer: Excellent, yes. Costa Blanca has been the UK's premier retirement destination for 30+ years. Healthcare is quality and affordable; English is widely spoken; cost of living is low; and established retirement communities provide immediate social networks. Winter temperatures (15-18°C) are manageable for most; summer heat (30-35°C) is offset by proximity to beaches and sea breezes. Many retirees relocate partially (winters here, summers in UK) for ideal living arrangement.

faqs.question: Wie weit ist die Costa Blanca von Deutschland entfernt?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport is 42 minutes from Rojales and offers direct flights to every major UK airport (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol, Newcastle, Edinburgh). Flight time is 2.5 hours; costs average £40-80 return if booked in advance. Many property owners commute regularly between UK and Spain—flights are reliable and frequent. The proximity makes this genuinely practical as a second home, not a distant investment.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional: 320+ days of sunshine annually, making it one of Europe's sunniest regions. Summer temperatures: 28-35°C (ideal beach weather, especially by evening). Winter: 10-18°C (mild and sunny—most days you'll need just a light jacket). Rainfall is minimal (300mm/year), concentrated in autumn. The Segura River location gives Rojales a slightly moderated microclimate compared to inland areas. This climate makes the property perfect for year-round use or extended holiday stays without heating or heavy air conditioning costs.
